Column Comment.0: DRILLING OPERATIONS CHECK SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set ofdrilling checks that may be mandated by an operating company, regulatory agency orcontract.
Column Comment.1: DRILLING CHECK TYPE: The type of check that is conducted, such as Daily WalkAround Inspection, H2S Signs Posted (if required), Well License and Stick DiagramPosted, Flare Lines Staked, BOP drills Performed, Visually inspect BOPs, Flarelinesand Degasser Lines
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CONTRACTOR INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that the contractor representativeis responsible for performing this check.
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION: Narrative description of the check to be peformed.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.7: CHECK FREQUENCY: The frequency that this check must be done, usually daily,weekly, monthly, each shift etc.
Column Comment.8: OPERATOR INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that the operatorrepresentative isresponsible for performing this check.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE DOCUMENT: The identifier for the source document in which the drillchecks are described, often a body of legislation, an agreement or recommendationscreated by a professional body, such as the CAODC or the IADC.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
